In 1983 AAFB was created from the initial Maricopa County Emergency Food Coordination Project and since then we have maintained the goal of ending hunger in Arizona. Throughout our history we have developed and grown several programs that assists in supporting our member food banks as well as all Arizona hunger relief efforts. Through these programs we collaborate with food banks, government agencies, community organizations, schools and various other partners to establish a unified focus on creating a hunger-free Arizona.

The Desert Botanical Garden’s Monarch Council is comprised of mid-career professional leaders who are committed to community engagement, professional development and networking and are passionate about the pillars of the Garden’s mission: scientific research, education, plant conservation and exhibition while being cultivated as potential Desert Botanical Garden Board of Trustees.

Roosevelt Row Community Development Corporation (CDC) is a 501(c)3 non-profit community development corporation established to further the unique cultural character and creative assets of the Roosevelt Row Arts District, to advocate for the continuing presence and role of the arts and small business in the revitalization of the district, and to foster a dense, diverse and walkable urban community.

summary: I specialize in working with ambitious leaders to build and refresh strong brands, design effective strategies, and produce enduring creative experiences. I love working at the intersection of creativity, community, and purpose.  Over the last 12 years I have directed multiple arts businesses, built nonprofits from the ground up, and managed numerous national and international creative projects. I studied Art History as an undergraduate, got my Masters Degree in Arts Management from Carnegie Mellon, and am a certified Project Management Professional (PMP). In my free time, you'll find me in the mountains, adventuring (my next big trip is Antarctica!), or volunteering in the community. I sit on the Art Advisory Committee and Monarch Council at the Desert Botanical Garden, helping to build Spaces of Opportunity, an 18-acre community garden in South Phoenix. I also serve on the board of the Arizona Association of Food Banks and is a former Vice President of the Roosevelt Row Community Development Corporation. My Specialties: Producing creative projects, arts curation, brand strategy, organization and planning, project management, exhibition management, strategic planning, facilitation
